channel.title: Just a little thought on Server Sources
channel.description:
So if im correct which I beleive I am, a server source is what makes a server looks the way it does when you log in.
I know people make these Server Souces like: Project Czar
The reason I use Project Czar as an example is because i see it is being used on a lot of servers. I am not sure if it is being "LEECHED" or if it is for everyone to use
The thing that gets me dissappointed is why people would use that sourse when they could make their own. Having 1-2 of the same source on server doesn't bother me, but when people pose like: Project soul (Made up name) it gets kind of annoying. I know creating a SERVER SOURCE takes loads of time but it could be worth it, you never know...
Just so you all know, I am not totally against using the same Server Souce. There are some positives about using the same source and one of them that is most common is probably when a server goes down and that is the only server with that type of look then you might get a little mad, but then you would have another Server to take its place.
I just thought you all might like to know that I am in the middle on the subject I am not on one whole side.
I Would like to hear your thought on this subject:
Please Choose any opinion you like
The more opinions we get the more interesting this subject can get!
Thank You for reading, I look forward to you posts!
~Nate

item.title: Just a little thought on Server Sources
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Nowhere, though true, my server is partially from scratch.

Took me a year though, but i never work on it, probably 30 minutes a day with distractions.

The reason I use Project Czar as an example is because i see it is being used on a lot of servers.
I am not sure if it is being “LEECHED” or if it is for everyone to use

The thing that gets me dissappointed is why people would use that sourse when they could make their own.

I just thought you all might like to know that I am in the middle on the subject I am not on one whole side.
